title: Analysis and Application of Flipped Learning-Based Instructional Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience in utilizing online learning tools
context.additional_context: A Course for Professionals in Healthcare, Legal, and Technical Fields to Strengthen Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills, Combining Self-Directed Learning with Discourse-Based Instruction via Personal Devices

learning_goals: Learners can analyze LMS access patterns in flipped classroom environments and explain three or more personalized learning strategies
Learners can utilize models to predict quiz/exam performance based on weekly learning data
Learners can establish personalized time allocation plans for learning activities aligned with flipped learning design principles

resources: Learning Analytics Tool (Access Log Visualization Module)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
